channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Opposite 87 Third Avenue jw Dart Street, 18th July
item.description:
3 oxygen canisters and 2 gas canisters opposite 87 Third Avenue

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Third Avenue, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Replace broken Bollards on Common, 18th July
item.description:
Numerous very old rotten bollards require replacing. Some are just rotten stumps sitting on the surface and others are constantly knocked over by service/Delivery vehicles and just held up with twigs. They fail to fulfil their original purpose to protect the common from vehicles etc and many have been in place for many decades; time & weather taking their toll.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wiltshire Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside numbers 34 and 36 Menelik Road, 18th July
item.description:
After various visits by different contractors, the street lamp is still not working. This has been an on going problem for well over 6 months. The last visit by a contractor was Sunday 13th July.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Menelik Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous "invisible" bollard, 18th July
item.description:
There is a bollard in the alleyway between Q Anne Avenue and the bridge over the railway that could do with some white or fluorescent paint. It is a hazard, as it's almost invisible, especially in poor light or, as today, in sunshine that casts mottled light on the alleyway. It's a miracle I haven't tripped over it even though I know it is there, and it must be dangerous for people with small children. Is it necessary? If not, please could it be removed. If so, please could it be painted. I'd be happy to do it myself if given permission!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree over hanging Road, 18th July
item.description:
Tree branches between bus stop and railway bridge are overhanging road….touching roof of 336 buses travelling towards Bromley. Same tree has lots of branches coming out of trunk making it difficult to walk past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Grove, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bin door - permanently open, 18th July
item.description:
The left bin door is broken and has been left permanently open for a number of weeks now. I have tried to close it and it does not seem to close. Also, two traffic cones and a road closed sign seem to have been dumped here too. Been here for more than a week now. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 451, Oxford Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bushes over hanging pavement & bus stop also impacting pavement., 18th July
item.description:
These bushes are hanging down towards pavement impacting pedestrians. Also badly overhanging bus stop/shelter limiting bus view. Lots of fruit fallen onto pavement causing lots of wasps flying around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southlands Grove, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Holtwhite's Hill, London

item.category: Graffiti (Offensive or up to 2 meters off the ground)

item.title: People taking drugs, overgrown area, 18th July
item.description:
In the alleyway bordering 29 Station Road a group of drunks gather to take drugs. The area is massively overgrown and needs cutting back. The area was cleared last summer but has grown back and the same people have returned. It’s a fire hazard and close to housing. Can the whole are be tidied up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nw6 7hb, 18th July
item.description:
The tree on the street is causing mold issues in Hazelmere 26 and 28 due to the way it's growing. There's been an expert out for Hazelmere 28 - case here 52015939/1. Please can this tree be removed asap. It's causing mold growth in my baby room. I also need to to understand how brent will cover for any damage caused in my house.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hazelmere Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
